item.title: Basics of Database Partitioning and Partition Strategies
item.description: You are a part of a startup which has recently scaled to reach a huge number of users. This means that the increased number of users are going to generate a huge amount of data that you have to store and manage. It soon becomes evident that managing a huge dataset is a major hurdle to achieve query efficiency and it might make sense to break the database down into smaller and much more manageable chunks, just like good old low scale days.

item.title: Tackling Lost Updates Problem In Database Using Stricter Transaction Isolation Level
item.description: ** Introduction** Databases are made for scale and are a highly concurrent system. Thus it is normal for them to expect multiple concurrent connections. Also, in most situations, we’ll want our database to be the source of truth and always contain consistent data. There are many concurrency related phenomena that can occur in a database when multiple transactions try to access/modify the same block of data. Ex dirty reads, dirty writes etc.
